intro: Hieracium libanoticum, commonly known as the Lebanon hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium libanoticum is often found in meadows, rocky slopes, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
